Sub: 
Guarding of Refusal Room at the airports. 
 
 
It has been pointed out that there is no uniform practice with regard to guarding of 
refusal room at airports. Any passenger refused entry into India is handed over to the 
concerned air-carrier for removing him from Indian soil at the earliest as per ICAO 
convention. Thereafter, it becomes the responsibility of the air-carrier to hold the 
passenger with them till his eventual removal. However, till such time the Airline could 
arrange for removal, such passenger is detained in the Refusal/ Detention Room. 
 
To ensure that such passenger does not  slip away from the airport, it is essential 
that the refusal  room is guarded by the armed guards at the airport till the passenger is 
taken out for boarding the aircraft. It has , therefore, been decided that a separate refusal 
room for the purpose shall be earmarked by the AAI in consultation with the immigration 
authorities at each international airport. Whenever there is a passenger in the guard room 
it will be guarded by CISF to ensure that the passenger does not escape from custody and 
is deported out of India. 
 
 
(R.C. Tayal) 
Offg. Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation)
